page.syntax: Largest_Of_Values as A = TABLEMAX(C tablename,C filter,C field)

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The full drive, path, name, and extension of the table. If you omit the drive, path, and extension, Alpha Anywhere searches the directory of the current table.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value. Selects records to examine.

argument.name: field
argument.description: An expression based on character, numeric, date, or exponent numeric field(s) in the Lookup_Table.

page.description: Returns the maximum value of matching records in a specified table.
page.discussion: Searches the specified Lookup_Table for one or more records that satisfy the specified Filter, and returns the largest of the values contained in the Lookup_Expression. The Filter must return a logical value, either True (.T.) or False (.F.). For example, to choose all of the records in a table, use the logical constant ".T." as a filter. To choose only the records where the STATE field is equal to TN, use the filter "STATE = 'TN'". Note that the entire filter is always in quotations, and the character value, TN, is in single quotes. Note : If no records satisfy the filter, Alpha Anywhere returns a zero value.
